div.l: But soth playe quade pleye as þe flemyng saithe
And þer for͗e henry bailliff be þi faithe
Be þou not wrooth er we deꝑparten her͗e
Thogh þat my tale be of an Osteler͗e
But natheles I will not tellen̄ it ȝit
But or we parte I wys þou schalte be quytte
And þer with all logh and made goode cher͗e
And saide his tale as ȝe schall after her͗e
¶ Here endith þe ꝓprologe
and her begynneth þe tale
A prentys whilom dwelled in our͗e Citee
And of a Crafte of viteyllers was he
Gaillard he was as goldfynche in þe schawe
Broune as bery a ꝓpropre schorte felowe
With lokkes y kembed full fetisly
Daunce he couthe so wele and Iolily
That he was cleped parkyn reuellour͗e
He was all full of loue and ꝑparamour͗e
As is þe hyve full of hony swete
Wele was þe wenche wyth hym miȝht mete
At eủery bride ale wolde he synge and hoppe
He loued bett̉er þe taủerne þan þe schoppe
For when̄ þer eny rydynge was in chepe
Oute of þe schoppe þider wolde he lepe
Till þat he had all þe siȝht y seyne
And daunced wele wold he not com̄ a gayn̄
And gadred hym a menȝee of his sorte
To hoppe and synge and make suche desporte
And þer þei setten̄ steuen̄ for to mete
To pleyen at þe dyse in suche a strete
For in þe toune nas þ̉er no p̉rentys
That fairer couthe caste a pair͗e of dyse
Than p̉erkyn couthe and þ̉er to he was free
Of his dispense in place of priuete
That fonde his maist̉er wele in his chaffar͗e
For ofte tyme he fonde his box full bar͗e
For sikerly a prentys reuelour
That hauntith dise ryoth or ꝑparamoᵘur
His maist̉er schuld it in his schop a bye
Al haf he not parte of his mimstralsie
For thefte and ryote þei bene ꝯconuertible
Al con̄ he pleye on gyterne or on ribible
Reuell and trowth as in lowe degree
Thei bene full wrothe al day as men̄ may see
This Ioly prentis with his maist̉er boode
Till he wer͗e neiȝh oute of his prentyshode
